dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.trigger

Class AbstractConfigurableTrigger

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.trigger.AbstractTrigger
      • dreisoft.tresos.guidedconfig.api.trigger.AbstractConfigurableTrigger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractTrigger>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoConfigureTrigger, SidebarTrigger

    public abstract class AbstractConfigurableTrigger
extends AbstractTrigger
    Trigger that are registered via extension-point implement the AbstractConfigurableTrigger class. An AbstractConfigurableTrigger gets a visibility formula from the extension-point via the <visible> tag and evaluate the result of isVisible() accordingly.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip

      • AbstractConfigurableTrigger

        public AbstractConfigurableTrigger(java.lang.String id,
                                   java.lang.String wizardId,
                                   java.lang.String wizardType,
                                   boolean undoRedo,
                                   java.lang.String label,
                                   org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image icon,
                                   java.lang.String description,
                                   java.lang.String type)
        Constructor for wizards with an explicit wizard type.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        wizardType - AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG | AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_EDITOR
        undoRedo - If the trigger shall provide undo/Redo functionality (only relevant for Dialogs!)
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        type - The type of the trigger

      • AbstractConfigurableTrigger

        public AbstractConfigurableTrigger(java.lang.String id,
                                   java.lang.String wizardId,
                                   java.lang.String wizardType,
                                   boolean undoRedo,
                                   java.lang.String label,
                                   org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image icon,
                                   java.lang.String description,
                                   java.lang.String type,
                                   int width,
                                   int height)
        Constructor for wizards with an explicit wizard type.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the trigger
        wizardId - The id of the wizard
        wizardType - AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG | AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_EDITOR
        undoRedo - If the trigger shall provide undo/Redo functionality (only relevant for Dialogs!)
        label - The label in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on the button)
        icon - The optional icon shown in the GUI of the trigger (e.g. on a button)
        description - The optional tooltip
        type - The type of the trigger
        width - The initial width (only used for wizardType AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG)
        height - The initial height (only used for wizardType AbstractTrigger.WIZARD_TYPE_DIALOG)
        Since:
        18.0

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Checks if the restriction from the extension point is matched in addition to the general restriction checked in
        Overrides:
        isVisible in class AbstractTrigger
        Returns:
        true if the trigger matches the current context, false if not
        Since:
        2008.b
        See Also:
